subject: statistics
title: Student's t-Distribution
contentHtml: The Student's t-distribution is a continuous probability distribution that arises when estimating population means from independent and identically distributed samples.
intuition: The Student's t-distribution provides a way to quantify the uncertainty in estimating population means when the sample size is small.
realWorldApplications: In machine learning, the Student's t-distribution is used as a prior distribution for model parameters.

subject: statistics
title: Student's t-Distribution Theorem
contentHtml:
The Student's t-distribution is a probability distribution that arises in statistical inference, particularly in hypothesis testing and confidence intervals.

It is used to model the behavior of sample means when the population standard deviation is unknown or difficult to estimate.

theorem.proofSketch: The proof involves showing that the Student's t-distribution is the limiting distribution of the sample mean when the population standard deviation is unknown.

intuition: The Student's t-distribution provides a way to make inferences about a population mean when only a random sample of data is available. It takes into account the uncertainty in the sample mean and allows for more robust conclusions.
realWorldApplications: In machine learning, the Student's t-distribution is used as a prior distribution for model parameters, allowing for more flexible modeling and improved generalization.
